definition[0]: used when someone wants to do something soon but you want to wait a little
example[0]: ‘When can we open our presents, Mum?’ ‘All in good time, Billy.’
definition[1]: used to tell someone to be patient because something they are waiting for will certainly happen after a period of time, and probably quite soon
example[1]: ‘I’d love to see it.’ ‘All in good time.’
